comment:
* A listener class for monitoring changes in specific telephony states * on the device, including service state, signal strength, message * waiting indicator (voicemail), and others. *

* Override the methods for the state that you wish to receive updates for, and * pass your PhoneStateListener object, along with bitwise-or of the LISTEN_ * flags to {@link TelephonyManager#listen TelephonyManager.listen()}. Methods are * called when the state changes, as well as once on initial registration. *

* Note that access to some telephony information is * permission-protected. Your application won't receive updates for protected * information unless it has the appropriate permissions declared in * its manifest file. Where permissions apply, they are noted in the * appropriate LISTEN_ flags.

variables.name: DBG
variables.comment: STOPSHIP if true

variables.name: FLAG_PER_PID_REGISTRATION_LIMIT
variables.comment:
* Experiment flag to set the per-pid registration limit for PhoneStateListeners
     *
     * Limit on registrations of {@link PhoneStateListener}s on a per-pid
     * basis. When this limit is exceeded, any calls to {@link TelephonyManager#listen} will fail
     * with an {@link IllegalStateException}.
     *
     * {@link android.os.Process#PHONE_UID}, {@link android.os.Process#SYSTEM_UID}, and the uid that
     * TelephonyRegistry runs under are exempt from this limit.
     *
     * If the value of the flag is less than 1, enforcement of the limit will be disabled.
     * @hide

variables.name: DEFAULT_PER_PID_REGISTRATION_LIMIT
variables.comment:
* Default value for the per-pid registation limit.
     * See {@link #FLAG_PER_PID_REGISTRATION_LIMIT}.
     * @hide

variables.name: PHONE_STATE_LISTENER_LIMIT_CHANGE_ID
variables.comment:
* This change enables a limit on the number of {@link PhoneStateListener} objects any process
     * may register via {@link TelephonyManager#listen}. The default limit is 50, which may change
     * via remote device config updates.
     *
     * This limit is enforced via an {@link IllegalStateException} thrown from
     * {@link TelephonyManager#listen} when the offending process attempts to register one too many
     * listeners.
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_NONE
variables.comment:
* Stop listening for updates.
     *
     * The PhoneStateListener is not tied to any subscription and unregistered for any update.

variables.name: LISTEN_SERVICE_STATE
variables.comment:
*  Listen for changes to the network service state (cellular).
     *
     *  @see #onServiceStateChanged
     *  @see ServiceState

variables.name: LISTEN_SIGNAL_STRENGTH
LISTEN_MESSAGE_WAITING_INDICATOR
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the message-waiting indicator. * {@more} * Requires Permission: {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PHONE_STATE * READ_PHONE_STATE} or that the calling app has carrier privileges (see * {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). *

* Example: The status bar uses this to determine when to display the * voicemail icon. * * @see #onMessageWaitingIndicatorChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_CALL_FORWARDING_INDICATOR
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the call-forwarding indicator.
     * {@more}
     * Requires Permission: {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PHONE_STATE
     * READ_PHONE_STATE} or that the calling app has carrier privileges (see
     * {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}).
     *
     * @see #onCallForwardingIndicatorChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_CELL_LOCATION
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the device's cell location. Note that * this will result in frequent callbacks to the listener. * {@more} * Requires Permission: {@link android.Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION * ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION} *

* If you need regular location updates but want more control over * the update interval or location precision, you can set up a listener * through the {@link android.location.LocationManager location manager} * instead. * * @see #onCellLocationChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_CALL_STATE
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the device call state.
     * {@more}
     *
     * @see #onCallStateChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_DATA_CONNECTION_STATE
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the data connection state (cellular).
     *
     * @see #onDataConnectionStateChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_DATA_ACTIVITY
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the direction of data traffic on the data
     * connection (cellular).
     * {@more}
     * Example: The status bar uses this to display the appropriate
     * data-traffic icon.
     *
     * @see #onDataActivity

variables.name: LISTEN_SIGNAL_STRENGTHS
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the network signal strengths (cellular). *

* Example: The status bar uses this to control the signal-strength * icon. * * @see #onSignalStrengthsChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_ALWAYS_REPORTED_SIGNAL_STRENGTH
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes of the network signal strengths (cellular) always reported from modem,
     * even in some situations such as the screen of the device is off.
     *
     * @see #onSignalStrengthsChanged
     *
     * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_CELL_INFO
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to observed cell info.
     *
     * Listening to this event requires the {@link Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION}
     * permission.
     *
     * @see #onCellInfoChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_PRECISE_CALL_STATE
variables.comment:
* Listen for {@link android.telephony.Annotation.PreciseCallStates} of ringing, * background and foreground calls. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE} * or the calling app has carrier privileges * (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). * * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_PRECISE_DATA_CONNECTION_STATE
variables.comment:
* Listen for {@link PreciseDataConnectionState} on the data connection (cellular). * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE} * or the calling app has carrier privileges * (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). * * @see #onPreciseDataConnectionStateChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_DATA_CONNECTION_REAL_TIME_INFO
LISTEN_SRVCC_STATE_CHANGED
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the SRVCC state of the active call. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRIVILEGED_PHONE_STATE} * * @see #onServiceStateChanged(ServiceState) * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_OEM_HOOK_RAW_EVENT
variables.comment:
* Listen for OEM hook raw event
     *
     * @see #onOemHookRawEvent
     * @hide
     * @deprecated OEM needs a vendor-extension hal and their apps should use that instead

variables.name: LISTEN_CARRIER_NETWORK_CHANGE
variables.comment:
* Listen for carrier network changes indicated by a carrier app.
     *
     * @see #onCarrierNetworkRequest
     * @see TelephonyManager#notifyCarrierNetworkChange(boolean)
     * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_VOICE_ACTIVATION_STATE
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the sim voice activation state * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRIVILEGED_PHONE_STATE} * * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_ACTIVATING * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_ACTIVATED * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_DEACTIVATED * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_RESTRICTED * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_UNKNOWN * {@more} * Example: TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_ACTIVATED indicates voice service has been * fully activated * * @see #onVoiceActivationStateChanged * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_DATA_ACTIVATION_STATE
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the sim data activation state
     * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_ACTIVATING
     * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_ACTIVATED
     * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_DEACTIVATED
     * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_RESTRICTED
     * @see TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_UNKNOWN
     * {@more}
     * Example: TelephonyManager#SIM_ACTIVATION_STATE_ACTIVATED indicates data service has been
     * fully activated
     *
     * @see #onDataActivationStateChanged
     * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_USER_MOBILE_DATA_STATE
variables.comment:
*  Listen for changes to the user mobile data state
     *
     *  @see #onUserMobileDataStateChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_DISPLAY_INFO_CHANGED
variables.comment:
*  Listen for display info changed event.
     *
     *  Requires Permission: {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PHONE_STATE
     *  READ_PHONE_STATE} or that the calling app has carrier privileges (see
     *  {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}).
     *
     *  @see #onDisplayInfoChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_PHONE_CAPABILITY_CHANGE
variables.comment:
*  Listen for changes to the phone capability.
     *
     *  @see #onPhoneCapabilityChanged
     *  @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_ACTIVE_DATA_SUBSCRIPTION_ID_CHANGE
variables.comment:
*  Listen for changes to active data subId. Active data subscription is
     *  the current subscription used to setup Cellular Internet data. For example,
     *  it could be the current active opportunistic subscription in use, or the
     *  subscription user selected as default data subscription in DSDS mode.
     *
     *  @see #onActiveDataSubscriptionIdChanged

variables.name: LISTEN_RADIO_POWER_STATE_CHANGED
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the radio power state. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRIVILEGED_PHONE_STATE} * * @see #onRadioPowerStateChanged * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_EMERGENCY_NUMBER_LIST
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to emergency number list based on all active subscriptions. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PHONE_STATE} or the calling * app has carrier privileges (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}).

variables.name: LISTEN_CALL_DISCONNECT_CAUSES
variables.comment:
* Listen for call disconnect causes which contains {@link DisconnectCause} and * {@link PreciseDisconnectCause}. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE} * or the calling app has carrier privileges * (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). *

variables.name: LISTEN_CALL_ATTRIBUTES_CHANGED
variables.comment:
* Listen for changes to the call attributes of a currently active call. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE} * or the calling app has carrier privileges * (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). * * @see #onCallAttributesChanged * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_IMS_CALL_DISCONNECT_CAUSES
variables.comment:
* Listen for IMS call disconnect causes which contains * {@link android.telephony.ims.ImsReasonInfo} * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE} * or the calling app has carrier privileges * (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). * * @see #onImsCallDisconnectCauseChanged(ImsReasonInfo)

variables.name: LISTEN_OUTGOING_EMERGENCY_CALL
variables.comment:
* Listen for the emergency number placed from an outgoing call. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_ACTIVE_EMERGENCY_SESSION} * * @see #onOutgoingEmergencyCall * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_OUTGOING_EMERGENCY_SMS
variables.comment:
* Listen for the emergency number placed from an outgoing SMS. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_ACTIVE_EMERGENCY_SESSION} * * @see #onOutgoingEmergencySms * @hide

variables.name: LISTEN_REGISTRATION_FAILURE
variables.comment:
* Listen for Registration Failures. * * Listen for indications that a registration procedure has failed in either the CS or PS * domain. This indication does not necessarily indicate a change of service state, which should * be tracked via {@link #LISTEN_SERVICE_STATE}. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE} or * the calling app has carrier privileges (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). * *

Also requires the {@link Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION} permission, regardless * of whether the calling app has carrier privileges. * * @see #onRegistrationFailed

variables.name: LISTEN_BARRING_INFO
variables.comment:
* Listen for Barring Information for the current registered / camped cell. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE} or * the calling app has carrier privileges (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). * *

Also requires the {@link Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION} permission, regardless * of whether the calling app has carrier privileges. * * @see #onBarringInfoChanged

variables.name: mSubId
variables.comment: @hide

variables.name: callback
variables.comment: * @hide

methods.name: public void onServiceStateChanged(ServiceState serviceState)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when device service state changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * The instance of {@link ServiceState} passed as an argument here will have various levels of
     * location information stripped from it depending on the location permissions that your app
     * holds. Only apps holding the {@link Manifest.permission#ACCESS_FINE_LOCATION} permission will
     * receive all the information in {@link ServiceState}.
     *
     * @see ServiceState#STATE_EMERGENCY_ONLY
     * @see ServiceState#STATE_IN_SERVICE
     * @see ServiceState#STATE_OUT_OF_SERVICE
     * @see ServiceState#STATE_POWER_OFF

methods.name: public void onSignalStrengthChanged(int asu)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when network signal strength changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @see ServiceState#STATE_EMERGENCY_ONLY
     * @see ServiceState#STATE_IN_SERVICE
     * @see ServiceState#STATE_OUT_OF_SERVICE
     * @see ServiceState#STATE_POWER_OFF
     * @deprecated Use {@link #onSignalStrengthsChanged(SignalStrength)}

methods.name: public void onMessageWaitingIndicatorChanged(boolean mwi)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when the message-waiting indicator changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.

methods.name: public void onCallForwardingIndicatorChanged(boolean cfi)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when the call-forwarding indicator changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.

methods.name: public void onCellLocationChanged(CellLocation location)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when device cell location changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.

methods.name: public void onCallStateChanged(@CallState int state, String phoneNumber)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when device call state changes. *

* Reports the state of Telephony (mobile) calls on the device for the registered subscription. *

* Note: the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}. * If this TelephonyManager object was created with * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}. *

* Note: The state returned here may differ from that returned by * {@link TelephonyManager#getCallState()}. Receivers of this callback should be aware that * calling {@link TelephonyManager#getCallState()} from within this callback may return a * different state than the callback reports. * * @param state call state * @param phoneNumber call phone number. If application does not have * {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_CALL_LOG READ_CALL_LOG} permission or carrier * privileges (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}), an empty string will be * passed as an argument.

methods.name: public void onDataConnectionStateChanged(int state)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when connection state changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_DISCONNECTED
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_CONNECTING
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_CONNECTED
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_SUSPENDED

methods.name: public void onDataConnectionStateChanged(int state, int networkType)
methods.comment: * same as above, but with the network type.  Both called.

methods.name: public void onDataActivity(int direction)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when data activity state changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_ACTIVITY_NONE
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_ACTIVITY_IN
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_ACTIVITY_OUT
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_ACTIVITY_INOUT
     * @see TelephonyManager#DATA_ACTIVITY_DORMANT

methods.name: public void onSignalStrengthsChanged(SignalStrength signalStrength)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when network signal strengths changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.

methods.name: public void onCellInfoChanged(List<CellInfo> cellInfo)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when a observed cell info has changed or new cells have been added
     * or removed on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId s from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @param cellInfo is the list of currently visible cells.

methods.name: public void onPreciseCallStateChanged(@NonNull PreciseCallState callState)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when precise device call state changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     * @param callState {@link PreciseCallState}
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onCallDisconnectCauseChanged(int disconnectCause, int preciseDisconnectCause)

* Callback invoked when call disconnect cause changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @param disconnectCause {@link DisconnectCause}.
     * @param preciseDisconnectCause {@link PreciseDisconnectCause}.
     *

methods.name: public void onImsCallDisconnectCauseChanged(@NonNull ImsReasonInfo imsReasonInfo)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when Ims call disconnect cause changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @param imsReasonInfo {@link ImsReasonInfo} contains details on why IMS call failed.
     *

methods.name: public void onPreciseDataConnectionStateChanged(@NonNull PreciseDataConnectionState dataConnectionState)
methods.comment:
* Callback providing update about the default/internet data connection on the registered * subscription. * * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}. * If this TelephonyManager object was created with * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}. * *

Requires permission {@link android.Manifest.permission#MODIFY_PHONE_STATE} * or the calling app has carrier privileges * (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). * * @param dataConnectionState {@link PreciseDataConnectionState}

     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to

     * @hide

     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers

     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the

     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers

methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when the user mobile data state has changed on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @param enabled indicates whether the current user mobile data state is enabled or disabled.

methods.name: public void onDisplayInfoChanged(@NonNull TelephonyDisplayInfo telephonyDisplayInfo)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when the display info has changed on the registered subscription. *

The {@link TelephonyDisplayInfo} contains status information shown to the user based on * carrier policy. * * Requires Permission: {@link android.Manifest.permission#READ_PHONE_STATE} or that the calling * app has carrier privileges (see {@link TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}). * * @param telephonyDisplayInfo The display information.

methods.name: public void onEmergencyNumberListChanged(@NonNull Map<Integer, List<EmergencyNumber>> emergencyNumberList)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when the current emergency number list has changed on the registered
     * subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @param emergencyNumberList Map including the key as the active subscription ID
     *                           (Note: if there is no active subscription, the key is
     *                           {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId})
     *                           and the value as the list of {@link EmergencyNumber};
     *                           null if this information is not available.
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onOutgoingEmergencyCall(@NonNull EmergencyNumber placedEmergencyNumber)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when an outgoing call is placed to an emergency number.
     *
     * @param placedEmergencyNumber the emergency number {@link EmergencyNumber} the call is placed
     *                              to.
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onOutgoingEmergencySms(@NonNull EmergencyNumber sentEmergencyNumber)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when an outgoing SMS is placed to an emergency number.
     *
     * @param sentEmergencyNumber the emergency number {@link EmergencyNumber} the SMS is sent to.
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onOemHookRawEvent(byte[] rawData)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when OEM hook raw event is received on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * Requires the READ_PRIVILEGED_PHONE_STATE permission.
     * @param rawData is the byte array of the OEM hook raw data.
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onPhoneCapabilityChanged(PhoneCapability capability)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when phone capability changes.
     * Note, this callback triggers regardless of registered subscription.
     *
     * @param capability the new phone capability
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onActiveDataSubscriptionIdChanged(int subId)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when active data subId changes.
     * Note, this callback triggers regardless of registered subscription.
     *
     * Requires the READ_PHONE_STATE permission.
     * @param subId current subscription used to setup Cellular Internet data.
     *              For example, it could be the current active opportunistic subscription in use,
     *              or the subscription user selected as default data subscription in DSDS mode.

methods.name: public void onCallAttributesChanged(@NonNull CallAttributes callAttributes)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when the call attributes changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * Requires the READ_PRECISE_PHONE_STATE permission.
     * @param callAttributes the call attributes
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onRadioPowerStateChanged(@RadioPowerState int state)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when modem radio power state changes on the registered subscription.
     * Note, the registration subId comes from {@link TelephonyManager} object which registers
     * PhoneStateListener by {@link TelephonyManager#listen(PhoneStateListener, int)}.
     * If this TelephonyManager object was created with
     * {@link TelephonyManager#createForSubscriptionId(int)}, then the callback applies to the
     * subId. Otherwise, this callback applies to
     * {@link SubscriptionManager#getDefaultSubscriptionId()}.
     *
     * @RequiresPermission(android.Manifest.permission.READ_PRIVILEGED_PHONE_STATE}
     * @param state the modem radio power state
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onCarrierNetworkChange(boolean active)
methods.comment:
* Callback invoked when telephony has received notice from a carrier
     * app that a network action that could result in connectivity loss
     * has been requested by an app using
     * {@link android.telephony.TelephonyManager#notifyCarrierNetworkChange(boolean)}
     *
     * Note, this callback is pinned to the registered subscription and will be invoked when
     * the notifying carrier app has carrier privilege rule on the registered
     * subscription. {@link android.telephony.TelephonyManager#hasCarrierPrivileges}
     *
     * @param active Whether the carrier network change is or shortly
     *               will be active. This value is true to indicate
     *               showing alternative UI and false to stop.
     *
     * @hide

methods.name: public void onRegistrationFailed(@NonNull CellIdentity cellIdentity, @NonNull String chosenPlmn, int domain, int causeCode, int additionalCauseCode)
methods.comment:
* Report that Registration or a Location/Routing/Tracking Area update has failed. * *

Indicate whenever a registration procedure, including a location, routing, or tracking * area update fails. This includes procedures that do not necessarily result in a change of * the modem's registration status. If the modem's registration status changes, that is * reflected in the onNetworkStateChanged() and subsequent get{Voice/Data}RegistrationState(). * *

Because registration failures are ephemeral, this callback is not sticky. * Registrants will not receive the most recent past value when registering. * * @param cellIdentity the CellIdentity, which must include the globally unique identifier * for the cell (for example, all components of the CGI or ECGI). * @param chosenPlmn a 5 or 6 digit alphanumeric PLMN (MCC|MNC) among those broadcast by the * cell that was chosen for the failed registration attempt. * @param domain DOMAIN_CS, DOMAIN_PS or both in case of a combined procedure. * @param causeCode the primary failure cause code of the procedure. * For GSM/UMTS (MM), values are in TS 24.008 Sec 10.5.95 * For GSM/UMTS (GMM), values are in TS 24.008 Sec 10.5.147 * For LTE (EMM), cause codes are TS 24.301 Sec 9.9.3.9 * For NR (5GMM), cause codes are TS 24.501 Sec 9.11.3.2 * Integer.MAX_VALUE if this value is unused. * @param additionalCauseCode the cause code of any secondary/combined procedure if appropriate. * For UMTS, if a combined attach succeeds for PS only, then the GMM cause code shall be * included as an additionalCauseCode. For LTE (ESM), cause codes are in * TS 24.301 9.9.4.4. Integer.MAX_VALUE if this value is unused.

methods.name: public void onBarringInfoChanged(@NonNull BarringInfo barringInfo)
methods.comment:
* Report updated barring information for the current camped/registered cell. * *

Barring info is provided for all services applicable to the current camped/registered * cell, for the registered PLMN and current access class/access category. * * @param barringInfo for all services on the current cell. * * @see android.telephony.BarringInfo

methodNames: public void onCallStateChanged(@CallState int state, String phoneNumber)
public void onDataConnectionStateChanged(int state, int networkType)
public void onCallDisconnectCauseChanged(int disconnectCause, int preciseDisconnectCause)
public void onEmergencyNumberListChanged(@NonNull Map<Integer, List<EmergencyNumber>> emergencyNumberList)
public void onRegistrationFailed(@NonNull CellIdentity cellIdentity, @NonNull String chosenPlmn, int domain, int causeCode, int additionalCauseCode)
